content.description: Sit start with your right hand on the arete and your left hand on a crimp to the left of the arete. Move up and left to the horizontal crack, match, then move your feet up, and get your right hand up to the next horizontal crack. Your left hand goes out far left to a crimp, and then top out.
content.location: It is on the West side of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit start using the same start as the

left line

, but your hands are crossed. Move up your right hand to the large slot in the crack. Your left hand goes to a small crimp on the side of the arete. Bump your left hand up to the next slot in the crack. Reach up with your left hand to a money jug, and top out.
content.location: It is on the West side of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit start this contrived line using the same sit as

West Middle

, but once your right hand is in the crack slot, turn your body, lay it back, and match hands. Your right hand goes to a crimp on the blunt arete, your left hand bumps up to the next slot in the crack, then top out.
content.location: It is on the West side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start, go up the blunt west side arete, and do big span compression moves with heel hooks.
content.location: It ascends the West side arete.

content.description:
Crouch start using the same start as

South Right

but instead of topping out, keep moving right on the sloping arete lip until the apex of height, then pull the lip, and top out.
content.location: It is on the South face of the boulder.

content.description: South Right is a contrived line, but it's good. Crouch start with your left hand on a large, sloping hold and your right hand out on a good edge. Move your left hand up to a sloper, and then move your high right hand to a good edge right of the diagonal crack. Move your left hand up to the angled ledge, then match, and top out.
content.location: It is on the South face of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on an undercling crimp and your right hand on an undercling crimp. Move up to the sloper ledge, then dyno to the lip or move your feet to reach the lip. Then jug haul to the top.
content.location: It is on the South face of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on an undercling crimp and your right hand on an undercling crimp. Move up to the sloping ledge and move left with higher foot holds. You can use the large undercling or keep your feet low and work the slopers. Continue left until the the ledge ends, then top out.
content.location: It is on the South face of the boulder.

content.description: Crouch start with your left hand on an angled sloper and your right hand on the lowest part of the large flake. Move your left hand up to the next angled sloper and your right hand to the top of the flake feature. Get taller feet, and then reach to a slopey edge below the lip or just dyno all the way to the top, then top out.
content.location: It is on the East side of the boulder.
